Contact Handler: Instance Record
column4: Description

Contact Handler: BQ Authentication Instance Record
BQ Authentication Instance Record
column4: The task updates the contact record authentication status field and handles the interaction with the Party Authentication service domain to get the required level of authentication for the contact

Contact Handler: BQ Routing Instance Record
BQ Routing Instance Record
column4: The task updates the contact record routing selection field and handles the interaction with the Contact Routing service domain to identify the servicing position/resource

Contact Handler: BQ Session Instance Record
BQ Session Instance Record
column4: The task updates the contact record activity record fields and handles the interaction with the Contact Dialogue service domain to initiate the servicing session

Contact Handler: BQ Session Instance Record
column4: An indicator of how the session was concluded (e.g. customer completed, hang-up, further servicing required)

Contact Handler: BQ History Instance Record
BQ History Instance Record
column4: The task updates the channel activity history to reflect the contact

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column3: Customer Contact Inbound or Outbound Indicator
column4: Indicates whether this is an inbound or outbound contact (inbound is customer initiated, outbound is servicing resource initiated)

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: Reference to the active network operating session used to access customer

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column3: Advanced Voice Service Operating Session Reference
column4: Reference to the active voice network used to access customer

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: Reference to the contact record assembled during the customer contact

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: The contact record consolidates all aspects of the contact that is cross-referenced by all  contact functions and called servicing sessions that make up the contact

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: The customer reference as provided by the contacting party and verified by the authentication function

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: The contact device can be determined by the channel operations facilities (e.g. URL/ANI-phone number)

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: The contact authentication level is determined by the authentication function and can be updated during the contact

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column3: Customer Contact Record Routing Selection Status
column4: The routing selections made through the contact

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: The requested service from a menu option can be indicated by the customer when initiating or during contact

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: The customer may provide details of servicing resource request when initiating or during contact

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column3: Customer Contact Record Servicing Event History
column4: Contact Handler can reference recent servicing activity for routing, security and servicing purposes (obtained from Service Domain Channel Activity History)

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column3: Customer Contact Record Servicing Position Reference
column4: Reference to the servicing position - can be where an inbound contact is routed, or the source of an outbound contact request

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column3: Customer Contact Record Servicing Resource Reference
column4: Reference to the servicing resource - can be to handle an inbound contact or the source of an outbound contact request

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: Records the actions performed during contact, including all dialogue sessions

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: Reference to any contact session dialogue records created during the contact - there can be several

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: The customer session dialogue details and log

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: Records the start and end date times for the contact

Contact Handler: CR Customer Contact Operating Session Instance Record
column4: Describes the interpreted result of the contact (e.g. completed, customer terminated, timed-out)
